name: Air Fryer Chicken Tenders
headline: Air Fryer Chicken Tenders
description: This weeknight supper is a kid-friendly and healthier alternative to your run-of-the-mill chicken fingers.

image.description: Food Network Kitchen’s Air-Fryer Chicken Tenders for NEW FNK, as seen on Food Network.
Food Network Kitchen’s Air-Fryer Chicken Tenders for NEW FNK, as seen on Food Network.
Food Network Kitchen’s Air-Fryer Chicken Tenders for NEW FNK, as seen on Food Network.

recipeInstructions.text: For the chicken: Combine the buttermilk, Worcestershire sauce and paprika in a resealable plastic bag. Add the chicken, making sure it is completely coated. Seal the bag and place in a bowl. Let marinate at room temperature for 1 hour.
Meanwhile, stir together the panko with the Parmesan, olive oil and 1 teaspoon salt in a shallow baking dish or pie plate.
For the dipping sauce: Stir together the mayonnaise, yellow mustard, honey and Dijon in a small bowl and set aside.

Preheat a 3.5-quart air fryer to 390 degrees F. Remove 1 piece of chicken at a time from the bag, shaking off excess buttermilk. Place in the panko and press gently with your hands to adhere the panko evenly. Gently shake to remove the excess and place in the air fryer basket. Repeat with enough chicken to fill the basket (about 4 pieces) and cook until golden brown and cooked through, about 7 minutes on each side. Repeat with the remaining chicken and serve warm with the dipping sauce.

review.reviewBody: Excellent
Really tasty. I was out if Worcestershire so I added onion powder, garlic powder, salt and cayenne pepper to the buttermilk. Just saying YES!
I love it so much I could eat it all day long
These are delicious! And the honey mustard sauce is the bomb!
Some personal changes.  I would have like a little more Worcestershire Sauce, and to pepper the breading.

Thank you, FNK. These chickens tenders are more like the ones I make in shallow quick fry skillet and finish in oven on a pan with a rack. So hard to believe they are made with just a hot air method. My older son likes this kind the best because he feels they are healthier. When eating them with a slightly oil texture it makes him feel like he is eating poison. He cannot seem to get past the greasy foods. Honestly, I love a greasy salty fried up thingy, but only a bite or two because I'm not completely irresponsible .. yet. :)
Best crispy tenders yet
Wow!  Everyone in my family LOVED these, and we have some very picky eaters. Highly recommend it!

I made these tonight and they were delicious!! I didn’t have buttermilk so I mixed milk with 1tsp lemon juice. I had chicken breast so I cut into some fat tenders, like 4-5 pieces. Made the marinade and let sit out for 1 hour. Dipped in panko mixture and cooked in air fryer for 14 mins flipping halfway through. They’re so good!!!!!! And moist! My husband said make sure you write this recipe down.
these were dry, not crunchy, and nor chicken-y. you didn't specify what chicken to use so i bought dollar tree chicken. absolutely disgusting. do not do this.

So good! I didn’t have worcester sauce, so I subbed it out for a little ranch, and then I used 2% milk with a teaspoon of lemon like the app recommends instead of buttermilk. These are such a good, easy step up from frozen chicken tenders and I loved them!

It's wonderful that Food Network recognizes that an air fryer is viable means to cook with, and I'm greatful for the increase in recipes using this appliance. With that said, this recipe is delicious and easy dish to fix for someone just starting to use this culinary machine.
Really easy to make! Crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. Sauce is excellent as well!

I did refrigerate for the hour, used whole milk, corn flake crumbs, and my air fryer for the first time and they came out perfect turned over and readjusted after 7 minutes. Very good. I will use again. We used Ranch and BBQ for dipping. Yum, hubby couldn't stop eating them, I thought he was going to eat mine!
The whole family liked it. I did not make the dip.
The kids and husband loved these, and they cooked so quickly!
I thought this recipe was great. It was my first air fryer recipe. My husband and I thought the chicken tenders were tasty and crispy. I will definitely make this again.
I did not like this one! It was edible, but I will not be making this again! I should've added my own spices because this was very bland.

we really enjoyed this recipe.  Like another reviewer, my air fryer must be a higher wattage because I only cooked mine about 10-11 min and flipped half way.  When the panko began to brown, I took them out.  Didn't have time to marinate -- chicken sat in just long enough for me to mix the bread crumb mixture.  Will definitely make again.
Chicken fingers were very good, but I could have achieved the same result in a hot oven much faster. I will make again- just cook them in a 425 degree oven. The honey mustard was amazing!

These were horrible!  I should've known that chicken seasoned only in buttermilk/paprika would have no taste whatsoever.  Followed directions and chicken in air fryer was quite dry.  I found another recipe on the web that used a few more seasonings as well as a bag of doritos incorporated into the breadcrumbs.  It was more flavorful, but still dry.  Waste of good buttermilk & chicken.
They were so tender and they had a nice crunch to it I made the sauce but I added a little red wine vinegar and Sriracha and it was so tasty

My kids loved it!  Super easy and flavorful. I used preseasoned Panko crumbs (seasoned with pecorino Romano) so skipped the Parmesan.  My air fryer runs hot so I did 11 minutes at 370 (flip at halfway) and it was perfect.  A weeknight favorite for sure!
I love these! I used the Instant Pot Air Fryer lis and they turned out great. I then tried using the oven—just meh. Made them several times!

Such a hit! It was Crispy on the outside while still being juicy on the inside. I only seasoned the chicken for about 35 mins due to not having a lot of time as well as I substituted the buttermilk with heavy cream and it was absolutely delicious. I used chicken breast tenderloins and used 5 pieces which was a little under a pound, you can definitely use less breadcrumbs in your mixture, still had about half the mix left over after breading the chicken.
My son loves them!!
Really great! I only needed about half the bread crumb mixture (I hate wasting!). Big hit with my son and the dipping sauce is fabulous!
Simple and easy. My family loves it!!
Tasty, crispy! Check fryer every 3 to 5 min to ensure not burnt.
Delicious and easy. Be sure to not over till your fryer
